title: Crypto Lotus - SEC

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents on Crypto Lotus, a California-based cryptocurrency hedge fund, which operates the following funds:
* Crypto Lotus Fund A LP (CIK 0001711635)
* Crypto Lotus Fund B, LLC (CIK 0001729101)
* Crypto Lotus Fund B (International), Ltd. (CIK 0001729160)

According to a civil suit, Crypto Lotus was investigated by the SEC sometime in 2019 or 2020 and was then issued a deficiency letter. Please search for this letter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Silverman

title: City of Cortez Employee and Board Member Turnover Rate

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 - resignation
2 - resign

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2002 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject


Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. PDF is not preferred, and seems to have issues displaying the entire fields.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: Ventilation and CO2 levels at CIA Headquarters

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ventilation and CO2 levels at CIA Headquarters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552 regarding ventilation upgrades and improvements performed (if any) at CIA headquarters from January 2019 to present (2024/05/08). I would be interested to know (where this information is disclosable):

- documents/communications/records regarding ventilation upgrades, especially but not necessarily exclusively regarding HEPA units, Far-UVC technologies, and similar;
- any available and disclosable metrics regarding CO2 levels within the CIA headquarters during that same time period;
- if not included under the above two items, notifications/emails/guidance for CIA staff regarding same

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noah B

title: Seeking Evidence Supporting Finding of Fact that the Attack on the USS Liberty was "Mistaken Identity"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Seeking Evidence Supporting Finding of Fact that the Attack on the USS Liberty was "Mistaken Identity"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the ship was attacked by the IDF on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

The Report of the US Navy Court of Inquiry convened to look into all aspects of the June 8, 1967 attack on our ship contains a Finding of Fact claiming “Available evidence combines to indicate the attack on LIBERTY on 8 June was in fact a case of mistaken identity.”

We are requesting to be provided with all of the “available evidence” reviewed that supports that Finding of Fact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: German Scientists

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: German Scientists
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

File 105-HQ-8090, captioned "German Scientists".

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2022 TV series "The Calling"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the TV series "The Calling," created by David E. Kelley and distributed through Peacock. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "The Calling," inclusive of every episode of the show on which DoD collaborated in any way. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Calling," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Attached is a list, released to me through FOIA by Dod, of TV and movie productions supported by DoD in 2023; "The Calling" is included on this list.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. title: Department of Defense support for 2024 documentary "Human Unity"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2024 documentary "Human Unity"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the documentary "Human Unity," directed by Mark Fisher and written by Michael Banker. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "Human Unity." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Human Unity," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Attached is a list, released to me through FOIA by Dod, of TV and movie productions supported by DoD in 2023; "Human Unity" is included on this list.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: 1050 Lebanon Road and 1107 Lebanon Road Sawmill Historic Research

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 - "1050 Lebanon Rd"
2 - "1050 Lebanon Road" or "1050 Lebanon Rd" or "1050 Lebanon Way"
3 - "ILC"
4 - "Industrial Log" or "Independent Log"
5 - Parcel Number 5611-233-00-003
6 - any discussion regarding Legal Summary Section: 23 Township: 36 Range: 16 TR IN W/2SW/4SW1/4; 9.64AC B226 P164 B406 P35
7 - containing text "Tony Moore" or "Anthony Moore"
8 - containing text "Mary Lancaster"
9 - "1107 Lebanon Road" or "1107 Lebanon Rd" or "1107 Lebanon Way"
10- Parcel Number 5611-224-00-034
11- "drive-in" or "drive in" or "old drive in"
12- containing text "sawmill" or "sawmill on Lebanon" 
13-containing text "LIVELY LOGGING"
14- containing text "Paula Lively" or "Jeff Lively"

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2002 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject


Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. PDF is not preferred, and seems to have issues displaying the entire fields.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: FBI support for History Channel TV series "America's Book of Secrets"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for History Channel TV series "America's Book of Secrets"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of any episodes of the fourth season (2021) of the History Channel TV series "America's Book of Secrets." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "America's Book of Secrets," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "America's Book of Secrets." Given that only the fourth season of the show was produced during the period for which the aforementioned document pertains (2019-2023), the FBI must have supported one or more episodes from the fourth season (2021).

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

    production of "The Spying Game" podcast series, hosted by Rory Bremner. Such
    documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production
    assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees
    of the FBI and the hosts and contributors of "The Spying Game" podcast,
    including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other
    forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such
    documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment
    liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.
    
    Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous
    FOIA request, confirming that, some time between 2019 and 2023, the FBI
    supported a production listed as "The Spying Game," which I presume is the
    above-named podcast series.
    
    I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit
    organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be
    used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a
    waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with
    organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the
    organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Brett Carollo

title: Barry Romo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Barry Romo
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. 

RECORDS REQUESTED

I request all records related to Barry Louis Romo. Mr. Romo was born on 24 July 1947 in San Bernardino, California, USA and died on 1 May 2024.  

PROOF OF DEATH

I have attached Mr. Romo’s news obituary from the Washington Post, as reprinted in Stars and Stripes.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

In addition to your standard search, please also perform a cross-reference search of records related to the following organizations and events to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Romo.

1. Vietnam Veterans Against the War
2. Iraq Veterans Against the War
3. United States Postal Service
4. Winter Soldier hearings

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you decide to charge me fees, please let me know in advance if those fees will exceed $25. 

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that you fulfill this request electronically, producing responsive records via email attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for responding to this request.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Immediate Disclosure Request Anti-racism training  with Karen Fleshman of Racy Conversations

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Immediate Disclosure Request Anti-racism training  with Karen Fleshman of Racy Conversations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all information relating to an anti-racism training session that took place the week of April 29, 2024, including the PowerPoint and/or other presentations given by Karen Fleshman and her firm Racy Conversations (http://racyconversations.com/mission-bio).

I am also requesting the contract and terms of Fleshman’s consulting/contracting agreement with SFMTA to include a copy of said contract and all of its terms including financial terms/ payments.

Also please include how Fleshman was chosen to teach this session as well as any other sessions she has taught or will be teaching.

This is a new Immediate Disclosure Requests (SF Admin Code 67.25(a)) directed to your agency and its department head. Your response is required by May 8, 2024. 

Rolling responses are requested (SFAC 67.25(d)) if you are unable to immediately produce records. You must provide exact copies of every responsive record. Do not: print and scan electronic records, provide only the final message in a thread instead of the entire thread, convert native files to PDFs, combine or merge multiple records together, or provide black and white versions of any color record. Provide only copies of records not requiring fees and in-person inspection of all other records (GC 6253).
Your non-exhaustive obligations:
* All withholding of any information must be justified in writing (SFAC 67.27).
* All withholdings by masking or deletion (aka redactions) must be keyed by footnote or other clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld (SFAC 67.26).
* You must respond to emailed requests (SFAC 67.21(b)).
* You must notify us of whether or not responsive records exist and/or were withheld for each request below (Gov Code 6253(c), 6255(b)).
* You must state the name and title of each person responsible for withholding any information (Gov Code 6253(d)).
* Do not impose any end-user restrictions upon me (Santa Clara Co. vs Superior Ct, 170 Cal.App 4th 1301); so if you use a website to publish records, please make them completely public without any login, sign-in, or agreement to any type of terms of use or acceptable use policies.
Your agency must do all of the above things in your response, and you cannot wait until we file complaints.
We have no duty to, and we will not again, remind the City of its obligations. Instead, we will file complaints for each and every Sunshine Ordinance or CPRA violation. We will continue to file complaints until the City’s procedures are modified to fully comply with the Sunshine Ordinance and CPRA, without caveat or exception.

PRESERVE AND DO NOT DESTROY ANY ORIGINALS OF RESPONSIVE RECORDS UNTIL THE FINAL ADJUDICATION OF ANY APPEALS - we will appeal all withholdings or Sunshine violations.

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

NOTE: Please be certain you have properly redacted all of your responses. Once you send them to us, there is no going back. The email address sending this request is a publicly- viewable mailbox. Nothing herein is legal, IT, or professional advice of any kind. The author disclaims all warranties, express or implied, including but not limited to all warranties of merchantability or fitness. In no event shall the author be liable for any special, direct, indirect, consequential, or any other damages whatsoever. The digital signature, if any, in this email is not an indication of a binding agreement or offer; it merely authenticates the sender. Please do not include any confidential information, as I intend that these communications with the City all be disclosable public records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Belle Reve

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City and County of San Francisco public records request #24-2817
communications.communication:
City and County of San Francisco ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #24-2817: The purpose of the immediate disclosure request is to expedite the City’s response to a “simple, routine, or otherwise readily answerable request.” Admin. Code 67.25(a). The Sunshine Ordinance specifies that for more extensive or demanding requests, the maximum deadlines for responding to a request apply. Admin. Code § 67.25(a). Thus, the requester’s designation of a request as an immediate disclosure request does not automatically make it so. Rather, a department may adhere to the time deadlines governing standard requests – an initial 10-day period for response, plus a possible extension of up to 14 additional days – if the extensive or demanding nature of the request would impose an undue burden on the department to respond immediately.  ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City and County of San Francisco.

I am also requesting the contract and terms of Fleshman’s consulting/contracting agreement with SFMTA to include a copy of said contract and all of its terms including financial terms/ payments. title: Cortez Planning and Zoning Commission Qualifications Validated by Whom - Sec 6.01 of city code, and Sec 4 Ord.No.873, Part 7

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am attempting to deconflict failure of City Councils past to adhere to appointment of qualified individuals owning real estate within City of Cortez at the time of appointment. 

Ref to 6.01 - Planning and zoning commission.	
(a)	Planning and Zoning Commission Created. The City of Cortez Code, Article II creates an advisory board known as the planning and zoning commission ("planning commission" or "commission"). 
(b)	Organization. The City of Cortez Code, Article II describes the organization, of the planning commission. (1) The commission consists of nine (9) members, five (5) members who are real estate owning, qualified, taxpaying electors of the city appointed by the city. The four remaining members shall be ex-officio members without vote and consist of the city manager, the zoning administrator, the city engineer and the mayor of the city council.
Retrieved from https://library.municode.com/co/cortez/codes/land_use?nodeId=LAND_USE_CODE_CH6ADPR_6.01PLZOCO on May 7, 2024

Sec. 4. - Appointment to boards and commissions.	
The city council shall by resolution establish qualifications for appointment to city boards and commissions, except where such qualifications are elsewhere established by the city charter or the code of ordinances.
(Ord. No. 873, Part 7 (part).)
Retrieved from https://library.municode.com/co/cortez/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTITHCH_ARTIIMUOF_S4APBOCO on May 7, 2024

Please provide emails, memos, notes, or other documents that relate to the validation of property ownership within 6.01.b.1 by city or other entities which states, 

"five (5) members who are real estate owning,..."

for these current commissioners

Chairman Robert Rime, 
Jim Skvorc, 
Katrina Weiss 
Emily Waldron 
Bob Bright

and for any commissioners in the past particularly Lance McDaniel.

Please provide these documents between the current date of May 7th, 2024 and Jan 1, 2019

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: Correctional officer shift data (2019 - 2022)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Correctional officer shift data (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information on the correctional officers working on each shift or day from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022 at all correctional facilities operated by the Arkansas Division of Correction. Specifically, I am seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following information for each day/shift: The full legal name of all employees with the title of correctional officer, correctional sergeant, corporal, captain, lieutenant, deputy warden, correctional warden, and major scheduled to work on that given day/shift, including whether they were absent, the reason for the absence, and the employees' race, sex, and employing facility. 

Thank you for your assistance with this request. Please do not hesitate to contact for questions or clarifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

communications.subject: FDLE Office of General Counsel
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement Office of General Counsel. This message is being provided as confirmation your message was received. You should receive a response to your inquiry as soon as possible.


If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE’s Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthened due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. Please feel free to contact us at (850) 410-7676, or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us, if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable is contained from the hyperlink below. We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

For Additional Information click http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx<https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx>

title: City of Cortez Planning and Zoning Interactions with Dona Thompson and Kirsten Sackett

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent To, From, CC, or BCC the following accounts:

"Kirsten Sackett" cortezplanning@gmail.com
"Kirsten Sackett" sackettk@ci.ellensburg.wa.us
"Kirsten Sackett" ksackett@cityofcortez.com

Please provide me the following information for all emails sent, received, or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2007 to present day to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is intended to lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney. I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. Please save yourself the step of transforming the CSV into a PDF for submittal. It will save effort and ultimately save taxpayer funds if you just send me the .csv file.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. When estimating cost of per page, please use the discretion allowed by the CORA statute to interpret the pages to be 11x17, multiple columns, and 4 point font. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly. Saving the step of transforming the CSV to PDF saves the City of Cortez time, saving the taxpayers of Cortez money. 
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: FBI support for 2021 TV movie "9/11's Unsettled Dust"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2021 TV movie "9/11's Unsettled Dust"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2021 TV movie "9/11's Unsettled Dust," directed by Lisa Katzman. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "9/11's Unsettled Dust," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that, some time between 2019 and 2023, the FBI supported the production of "9/11's Unsettled Dust."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Marin County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Marin County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Marin County Sheriff's Office (https://www.marinsheriff.org/about-us/administrative-support/corner-division) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Marin County Sheriff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

If there are unidentified deceased persons then please include a spreadsheet that includes SEX, RACE, Estimated Year Born, Date Body Found, Estimated Date of Death and the OCA and ORI #s.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Mono County Sheriff's Office (https://monosheriff.org/sheriff/page/coroner) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Mono County Sheriff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

If there are unidentified deceased persons then please include a spreadsheet that includes SEX, RACE, Estimated Year Born, Date Body Found, Estimated Date of Death and the OCA and ORI #s.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Amador County
communications.communication:
Mr. Delaware,

The Amador County Sheriff's Office is in receipt of your request for
information related to unidentified decedents within the County of Amador.
The information sought by this request is not tracked or compiled into any
other record, and so the information only exists as part of investigatory
files, which are exempt from disclosure pursuant to California Government
Code 7923.600.  Due to this exemption the Sheriff's Office will not release
the information sought.  If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this
further, feel free to give me a call.
-- 
Undersheriff Jarret Benov
Amador County Sheriff's Office
700 Court Street
Jackson CA 95642
209-223-6542 (Desk)
209-223-1609 (FAX)
